question: You are deploying a production application on Compute Engine. You want to prevent anyone from accidentally destroying the instance by clicking the wrong button. What should you do?

A.answer: Disable the flag ג€Delete boot disk when instance is deleted.ג€

B.answer: Enable delete protection on the instance.

C.answer: Disable Automatic restart on the instance.

question: Your company uses a large number of Google Cloud services centralized in a single project. All teams have specific projects for testing and development. TheDevOps team needs access to all of the production services in order to perform their job. You want to prevent Google Cloud product changes from broadening their permissions in the future. You want to follow Google-recommended practices. What should you do?

A.answer: Grant all members of the DevOps team the role of Project Editor on the organization level.

B.answer: Grant all members of the DevOps team the role of Project Editor on the production project.

C.answer: Create a custom role that combines the required permissions. Grant the DevOps team the custom role on the production project.

D.answer: Create a custom role that combines the required permissions. Grant the DevOps team the custom role on the organization level.

question: You are building an application that processes data files uploaded from thousands of suppliers. Your primary goals for the application are data security and the expiration of aged data. You need to design the application to:ג€¢ Restrict access so that suppliers can access only their own data.ג€¢ Give suppliers write access to data only for 30 minutes.ג€¢ Delete data that is over 45 days old.You have a very short development cycle, and you need to make sure that the application requires minimal maintenance. Which two strategies should you use?(Choose two.)

A.answer: Build a lifecycle policy to delete Cloud Storage objects after 45 days.

B.answer: Use signed URLs to allow suppliers limited time access to store their objects.

C.answer: Set up an SFTP server for your application, and create a separate user for each supplier.

D.answer: Build a Cloud function that triggers a timer of 45 days to delete objects that have expired.

E.answer: Develop a script that loops through all Cloud Storage buckets and deletes any buckets that are older than 45 days.

question: Your company wants to standardize the creation and management of multiple Google Cloud resources using Infrastructure as Code. You want to minimize the amount of repetitive code needed to manage the environment. What should you do?

A.answer: Develop templates for the environment using Cloud Deployment Manager.

B.answer: Use curl in a terminal to send a REST request to the relevant Google API for each individual resource.

C.answer: Use the Cloud Console interface to provision and manage all related resources.

D.answer: Create a bash script that contains all requirement steps as gcloud commands.

question: You are performing a monthly security check of your Google Cloud environment and want to know who has access to view data stored in your Google CloudProject. What should you do?

A.answer: Enable Audit Logs for all APIs that are related to data storage.

B.answer: Review the IAM permissions for any role that allows for data access.

C.answer: Review the Identity-Aware Proxy settings for each resource.

D.answer: Create a Data Loss Prevention job.

question: Your company has embraced a hybrid cloud strategy where some of the applications are deployed on Google Cloud. A Virtual Private Network (VPN) tunnel connects your Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) in Google Cloud with your company's on-premises network. Multiple applications in Google Cloud need to connect to an on-premises database server, and you want to avoid having to change the IP configuration in all of your applications when the IP of the database changes.What should you do?

A.answer: Configure Cloud NAT for all subnets of your VPC to be used when egressing from the VM instances.

B.answer: Create a private zone on Cloud DNS, and configure the applications with the DNS name.

C.answer: Configure the IP of the database as custom metadata for each instance, and query the metadata server.

D.answer: Query the Compute Engine internal DNS from the applications to retrieve the IP of the database.

question: You have developed a containerized web application that will serve internal colleagues during business hours. You want to ensure that no costs are incurred outside of the hours the application is used. You have just created a new Google Cloud project and want to deploy the application. What should you do?

A.answer: Deploy the container on Cloud Run for Anthos, and set the minimum number of instances to zero.

B.answer: Deploy the container on Cloud Run (fully managed), and set the minimum number of instances to zero.

C.answer: Deploy the container on App Engine flexible environment with autoscaling, and set the value min_instances to zero in the app.yaml.

D.answer: Deploy the container on App Engine flexible environment with manual scaling, and set the value instances to zero in the app.yaml.

question: You have experimented with Google Cloud using your own credit card and expensed the costs to your company. Your company wants to streamline the billing process and charge the costs of your projects to their monthly invoice. What should you do?

A.answer: Grant the financial team the IAM role of ג€Billing Account Userג€ on the billing account linked to your credit card.

B.answer: Set up BigQuery billing export and grant your financial department IAM access to query the data.

C.answer: Create a ticket with Google Billing Support to ask them to send the invoice to your company.

D.answer: Change the billing account of your projects to the billing account of your company.

question: You are running a data warehouse on BigQuery. A partner company is offering a recommendation engine based on the data in your data warehouse. The partner company is also running their application on Google Cloud. They manage the resources in their own project, but they need access to the BigQuery dataset in your project. You want to provide the partner company with access to the dataset. What should you do?

A.answer: Create a Service Account in your own project, and grant this Service Account access to BigQuery in your project.

B.answer: Create a Service Account in your own project, and ask the partner to grant this Service Account access to BigQuery in their project.

C.answer: Ask the partner to create a Service Account in their project, and have them give the Service Account access to BigQuery in their project.

D.answer: Ask the partner to create a Service Account in their project, and grant their Service Account access to the BigQuery dataset in your project.

question: Your web application has been running successfully on Cloud Run for Anthos. You want to evaluate an updated version of the application with a specific percentage of your production users (canary deployment). What should you do?

A.answer: Create a new service with the new version of the application. Split traffic between this version and the version that is currently running.

B.answer: Create a new revision with the new version of the application. Split traffic between this version and the version that is currently running.

C.answer: Create a new service with the new version of the application. Add an HTTP Load Balancer in front of both services.

D.answer: Create a new revision with the new version of the application. Add an HTTP Load Balancer in front of both revisions.
